segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI

segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI

segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using a WMI

segment.source: You can use Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 to manage your current configuration settings.
segment.target: You can use Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 to manage your current configuration settings.

segment.source: To manage MED-V workspace settings with a WMI
segment.target: To manage MED-V workspace settings with a WMI

segment.source: A WMI browsing tool lets you view and edit the settings in a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: A WMI browsing tool lets you view and edit the settings in a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The WMI provider is implemented by using the WMI Provider Extension framework from the Microsoft .Net Framework 3.5.
segment.target: The WMI provider is implemented by using the WMI Provider Extension framework from the Microsoft .Net Framework 3.5.

segment.source: The WMI provider is implemented in the rootmicrosoftmedv namespace and implements the class Setting.
segment.target: The WMI provider is implemented in the rootmicrosoftmedv namespace and implements the class Setting.

segment.source: The class Setting contains properties that correspond to the settings in the system registry under the HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMedv registry key.
segment.target: The class Setting contains properties that correspond to the settings in the system registry under the HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMedv registry key.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: WMI browsing tools can be used to delete or modify classes and instances.
segment.target: WMI browsing tools can be used to delete or modify classes and instances.

segment.source: Deleting or modifying certain classes and instances can result in the loss of valuable data and cause MED-V to function unpredictably.
segment.target: Deleting or modifying certain classes and instances can result in the loss of valuable data and cause MED-V to function unpredictably.

segment.source: You can use your preferred WMI browsing tool to view and edit MED-V configuration settings by following these steps.
segment.target: You can use your preferred WMI browsing tool to view and edit MED-V configuration settings by following these steps.

segment.source: Open your preferred WMI browsing tool with administrator permissions.
segment.target: Open your preferred WMI browsing tool with administrator permissions.

segment.source: Connect to the namespace rootmicrosoftmedv.
segment.target: Connect to the namespace rootmicrosoftmedv.

segment.source: Enumerate the instances to connect to the running instance.
segment.target: Enumerate the instances to connect to the running instance.

segment.source: You want to connect to the instance of the class Setting.
segment.target: You want to connect to the instance of the class Setting.

segment.source: An Object Editor window opens.
segment.target: An Object Editor window opens.

segment.source: The MED-V configuration settings are listed as Properties.
segment.target: The MED-V configuration settings are listed as Properties.

segment.source: Perform the following steps to edit a MED-V configuration setting in the WMI.
segment.target: Perform the following steps to edit a MED-V configuration setting in the WMI.

segment.source: In the list of Properties on the Object Editor window, double-click the name of the configuration setting you want to edit.
segment.target: In the list of Properties on the Object Editor window, double-click the name of the configuration setting you want to edit.

segment.source: For example, to edit MED-V URL redirection information, double-click the property UxRedirectUrls.
segment.target: For example, to edit MED-V URL redirection information, double-click the property UxRedirectUrls.

segment.source: A Property Editor window opens.
segment.target: A Property Editor window opens.

segment.source: Edit the value to update the configuration information.
segment.target: Edit the value to update the configuration information.

segment.source: For example, to edit MED-V URL redirection information, add or remove a web address in the list.
segment.target: For example, to edit MED-V URL redirection information, add or remove a web address in the list.

segment.source: Save the updated property settings.
segment.target: Save the updated property settings.

segment.source: After you have finished viewing or editing MED-V configuration settings, close the WMI browsing tool.
segment.target: After you have finished viewing or editing MED-V configuration settings, close the WMI browsing tool.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: In some cases, a restart of the MED-V workspace is required for changes to MED-V configuration settings to take effect.
segment.target: In some cases, a restart of the MED-V workspace is required for changes to MED-V configuration settings to take effect.

segment.source: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the Setting class.
segment.target: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the Setting class.

segment.source: The Setting class inherits from the ConfigValueProvider class.
segment.target: The Setting class inherits from the ConfigValueProvider class.

segment.source: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the ConfigValueProvider class.
segment.target: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the ConfigValueProvider class.
